org.mobicents.restcomm.android.client.sdk

Class RCDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • BroadcastReceiver
      • org.mobicents.restcomm.android.client.sdk.RCDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.mobicents.restcomm.android.sipua.SipUADeviceListener

    public class RCDevice
extends BroadcastReceiver
implements org.mobicents.restcomm.android.sipua.SipUADeviceListener
    RCDevice Represents an abstraction of a communications device able to make and receive calls, send and receive messages etc. Remember that in order to be notified of RestComm Client events you need to set a listener to RCDevice and implement the applicable methods, and also 'register' to the applicable intents by calling RCDevice.setPendingIntents() and provide one intent for whichever activity will be receiving calls and another intent for the activity receiving messages. If you want to initiate a media connection towards another party you use RCDevice.connect() which returns an RCConnection object representing the new outgoing connection. From then on you can act on the new connection by applying RCConnection methods on the handle you got from RCDevice.connect(). If there is an incoming connection you will be receiving an intent with action 'RCDevice.INCOMING_CALL'. At that point you can use RCConnection methods to accept or reject the connection. As far as instant messages are concerned you can send a message using RCDevice.sendMessage() and you will be notified of an incoming message through an intent with action 'RCDevice.INCOMING_MESSAGE'.
    See Also:
    RCConnection

      • connect

        public RCConnection connect(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters,
                   RCConnectionListener listener)
        Create an outgoing connection to an endpoint
        Parameters:
        parameters - Parameters such as the endpoint we want to connect to or SIP custom headers. If you want to pass SIP custom headers, you need to add a separate (String, String) HashMap inside 'parameters' hash and introduce your headers there. For an example please check HelloWorld or Messenger samples.
        listener - The listener object that will receive events when the connection state changes
        Returns:
        An RCConnection object representing the new connection or null in case of error. Error means that RCDevice.state not ready to make a call (this usually means no WiFi available)

        Parameters:

        parameters - Parameters used for the message, such as 'username' that holds the recepient for the message

      • setPendingIntents

        public void setPendingIntents(Intent callIntent,
                     Intent messageIntent)
        Set pending intents for incoming calls and messages. In order to be notified of RestComm Client events you need to associate your Activities with intents and provide one intent for whichever activity will be receiving calls and another intent for the activity receiving messages. If you use a single Activity for both then you can pass the same intent both as a callIntent as well as a messageIntent
        Parameters:
        callIntent: - an intent that will be sent on an incoming call
        messageIntent: - an intent that will be sent on an incoming text message
